head.supplied: Friday. ¶ ¶ I got your letter of the 29 Jun., ¶ dear Mr. Ware, concerning the books for America, but the requisition has not come back to me, nor does it appear, that it reached the printing office....

div.p: F74/8663, unit 742, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Friday.
Presumably the first Friday following 29 June, which was a Monday; hence 3 July.

I got your letter of the 29 Jun.,
See T. Ware to M, 29 June 1874. dear Mr. Ware, concerning the books for America, but the requisition has not come back to me, nor does it appear, that it reached the printing office. Should it have gone astray I can send an other; or to save time you might perhaps kindly forward a note direct across to Mr. Ferres. If you cause the volumes to be delivered at my town-adress, Argus Hotel, I will write the directions on them and send the whole to the C.S. office for transmission as requested.
Pray pass kindly also the requisition for a copy of vol. VI of the "Flora", wanted at this office (in the Hotel).
